etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin salutatio(n-), from salutare ‘pay one's respects to’ (see salute)

definitions: a gesture or utterance made as a greeting or acknowledgment of another's arrival or departure

examples.text: we greeted them but no one returned our salutations
he raised his glass in salutation

shortDefinitions: gesture or utterance made as greeting or acknowledgement of another's arrival or departure

definitions: a standard formula of words used in a letter to address the person being written to

examples.text: we would not expect a love letter to include a formal address and salutation

shortDefinitions: standard formula of words used in letter
